meals.name: Sweet Potato Toast with Avocado
meals.instruction:
1. Slice sweet potatoes lengthwise into 1/4 inch slices.
2. Add to the toaster-oven (or regular oven) cook the sweet
potato toast on 375-400 degrees for 15-20 minutes.
3. Remove skin from avocado and slice.
4. Add to toast and sprinkle with sea salt and some lemon
zest (optional).
Enjoy!
Additional Topping Options:
Toasted sesame seeds
Toasted sunflower seeds
Lime Juice
Hummus with or without the avocado

meals.name: Fall Harvest Salad
meals.instruction:
1. To make the dressing: add all dressing ingredients
(lemon, tahini, salt, cayenne pepper) into a little
bowl and whisk together until one smooth
consistency. Add water bit by bit as needed, if
consistency is too thick.
2. Place kale in a bowl, using 1/2 of the dressing
massage the kale until tender.
3. Top with the rest of the ingredients, remaining salad
dressing and mix well.

ingredients.name: Water, filtered (if needed to thin out consistency)

meals.name: Cardamom Quinoa Porridge
meals.instruction:
In a saucepan, bring quinoa, 3/4 cup almond milk, water,
vanilla, salt, and cardamom to a boil. Reduce heat and
simmer, covered, until liquid is absorbed, 15 minutes.
Remove from heat and let rest five minutes, then fluff with
a fork.
For each serving, top 1/2 cup quinoa with 1/2 cup almond
milk, 1/2 sliced pear, and 2 Tbsp almonds.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Sauerkraut
meals.instruction: Buy sauerkraut or other fermented veggies that contains only water, sea salt & spices/herbs. NO VINEGAR

ingredients.name: Sauerkraut (up to 1 tbsp for lunch & dinner to support gut flora & digestion of the food you are eating.)

meals.name: Hummus-Crusted Chicken
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 450�F. Prepare one large baking dish or two
smaller baking dishes with cooking spray.
Pat the chicken dry. Season the chicken breasts with
generous pinches of salt and pepper. In a large bowl, toss
the zucchini, squash and onion with olive oil until evenly
coated. Season with salt and pepper.
If using one baking dish, place all of the vegetables on the
bottom of the dish in an even layer. Lay the four chicken
breasts evenly on top, then cover each chicken breast with
the hummus so that the entire breast is covered. Squeeze
the juice of one lemon over the chicken and vegetables.
Then sprinkle the pan with smoked paprika or sumac. Thinly
slice the remaining lemon, and place the slices in between
the chicken and vegetables if desired.
**If using two pans, use one for the chicken and one for the
vegetables.**
Bake for about 25-30 minutes, until the chicken is cooked
through and the vegetables are tender. Serve immediately.

meals.name: Toasted Almond Butter
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 350�F.
Place almonds on a large baking sheet and toast for approximately 12-15 minutes.
Place toasted almonds into a large food processor. Process for 2 minutes, then stop and scrape down the sides.
Continue to process for about 7-12 minutes (depends on how powerful your food processor is). You will notice that the almonds will gradually change from a powder to form a large ball.
Continue processing and that ball will break down again and begin to resemble a coarse and pasty almond butter.
Continue processing until the almond butter becomes smooth and moist looking.
Store your almond butter in a glass jar and refrigerate. Note:
Yields 1 1/2 cups which is 24 tbsp. - 2 tbsp. per serving = 12 servings

meals.name: Sweet Potato Toast with Avocado
meals.instruction:
1. Slice sweet potatoes lengthwise into 1/4 inch slices.

3. Remove skin from avocado and slice.
4. Add to toast and sprinkle with sea salt and some lemon
zest (optional).
Enjoy!

Toasted sesame seeds
Toasted sunflower seeds
Lime Juice
Hummus with or without the avocado

meals.name: Beet-Ginger Smoothie Bowl
meals.instruction:
Place all the ingredients for the smoothie bowl together in a
high-speed blender and blend on high until smooth. 
Pour into a bowl and top with raspberries, pomegranate
seeds, honey, cacao nibs, and chia seeds.
Serve and enjoy!

meals.name: Greens and Beans with Rosemary and Thyme
meals.instruction:
Bring broth to a simmer in a large, high-sided skillet over
medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until
tender, stirring occasionally, about 7 minutes. 
Stir in greens, in batches if needed, along with beans,
rosemary, thyme and crushed red pepper. Cover, reduce
heat to medium and cook 5 minutes, stirring once. Uncover
and cook another 2 minutes or until greens are very tender. 
Stir in black pepper and serve.

meals.name: Fall Harvest Salad
meals.instruction:
1. To make the dressing: add all dressing ingredients

consistency. Add water bit by bit as needed, if
consistency is too thick.
2. Place kale in a bowl, using 1/2 of the dressing
massage the kale until tender.
3. Top with the rest of the ingredients, remaining salad
dressing and mix well.

ingredients.name: Water, filtered (if needed to thin out consistency)

meals.name: Chicken Zucchini Meat Balls
meals.instruction:
Toss chicken with zucchini, green onion, cilantro, garlic, salt,
and pepper and cumin. Mixture will be quite wet.
Heat oil in a medium pan over medium heat. Use a small
scoop or a heaped tablespoon to scoop meatballs into the
pan. Cook 8-10 at a time for about 5-6 minutes on the first
side. Flip and cook an additional 4-5 minutes, or until
golden brown and the centers are cooked through.

ingredients.name: Zucchini (leave peel on and squeeze grated zucchini in a kitchen towel to remove excess moisture)
Green onion, scallion, ramp (sliced or 1/2 medium white onion)

meals.name: Turmeric Chickpea Burgers (PEP)
meals.instruction:
In a large cast iron pan, drizzle in a little olive oil and fry the
onion and garlic until slightly golden but not burned.
Remove from heat and allow to cool.
In a food processor, process the chickpeas until they turn to
a slightly textured paste, be sure to turn off the food
processor and scrape down the sides to get all the
chickpeas ground up. Add in onion and garlic, salt, pepper,
turmeric and cayenne pepper and mix to fully combine.
Turn the food processor off and stir in the chopped parsley.
Take a large plate and sprinkle a few tablespoons of
chickpea flour onto it. Using a spoon, scoop some of the
mixture onto your hands and shape into a ball, the size of a
golf ball, and then press gently to make a patty.
Drop into the chickpea flour to coat evenly. If too much flour
sticks to the patty then gently dust it off with your fingers or
a pastry brush. You should have a very light coating all over
the patties/ burgers.
Reheat that same large cast iron pan to medium heat.
Drizzle in a little more oil and place the patties in to cook.
Cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side until the bottom is
nicely browned.
Serve with a big salad for a healthy lunch or dinner.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Honey Lime Quinoa Fruit Salad
meals.instruction:
Rinse and prepare the quinoa according to package. Let
quinoa cool to room temperature.
In a large bowl, combine quinoa, strawberries, blueberries,
and mango.
To make the glaze: In a small bowl combine the honey and
lime juice. Drizzle over the fruit salad and toss to coat.
Garnish with fresh basil.

meals.name: Hummus-Crusted Chicken
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 450�F. Prepare one large baking dish or two
smaller baking dishes with cooking spray.

meals.name: 3-Ingredient Banana Pancakes
meals.instruction:
In a mixing bowl, crack in the eggs and add in baking
powder. And whisk to combine.
In another bowl add in 1� large bananas. Lightly mash with
a potato masher or a fork, but not too much. There should
be chunks of bananas to make fluffy pancakes. And use
only ripe bananas.
Pour wet mixture into mashed bananas and stir to combine.
In a frying pan, cook mini pancakes over a medium low
heat. 1 or 2 tablespoons of batter is enough for each mini
pancake. When the baking powder is activated, flip it over
and cook for about one minute more. Serve immediately
when hot.

meals.name: Salmon with Avocado Salsa Oven Baked
meals.instruction:
Pre-heat the oven to 400 degrees.
Mix the cumin, paprika, garlic powder, black pepper, and
a 1/4 pinch of sea salt.
Coat the salmon with olive oil, the seasoning mix, and the
sliced onions.
Next, cover the pan with a glass lid (parchment paper and
then aluminum foil on top, so the toxins from the aluminum
don't go in the fish).
Place in the oven and cook until done, about 15-20 minutes
depending on the thickness of the fish.
Avocado Salsa
Combine the avocado, onion*, cilantro, lime juice, and 1/2
pinch of sea salt in a bowl and mix well,
Raw onion can be hard to digest. If you are healing
your gut either sautee or steam the onion or leave them
out.
Top the cooked salmon with avocado salsa and enjoy!

ingredients.name: Atlantic salmon, wild (cut into 6 pieces or 1 large piece)

meals.name: Wild rice salad
meals.instruction:
1. Cook the rice according to the packet instructions
until tender. Drain, then allow to cool.
2. Roughly chop the mixed nuts, pick and roughly chop
the basil and mint leaves, then roughly chop the
apricots.
3. Combine with the rice, season with sea salt and
black pepper, then drizzle with oil. Serve with grilled
meat or fish.

ingredients.name:
Wild rice, dry (mixed; such as
Camargue, wild and long-grain)

meals.name: Lentil, Kale & Sausage Stew
meals.instruction:
Heat oil in large pot over med-high heat. Add sausage and
cook until browned- about 8-10 mins.
Add onions and cook- about 3-5 mins. Add garlic and cook about 1 min. Add broth, kale, sweet potatoes, and lentils.
Bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer until lentils and sweet
potatoes are tender- about 30-35 mins

Bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer until lentils and sweet
potatoes are tender- about 30-35 mins

meals.name: 3-Ingredient Banana Pancakes
meals.instruction:
In a mixing bowl, crack in the eggs and add in baking
powder. And whisk to combine.
In another bowl add in 1� large bananas. Lightly mash with
a potato masher or a fork, but not too much. There should
be chunks of bananas to make fluffy pancakes. And use
only ripe bananas.
Pour wet mixture into mashed bananas and stir to combine.
In a frying pan, cook mini pancakes over a medium low
heat. 1 or 2 tablespoons of batter is enough for each mini
pancake. When the baking powder is activated, flip it over
and cook for about one minute more. Serve immediately
when hot.

meals.name: Fall Harvest Salad
meals.instruction:
1. To make the dressing: add all dressing ingredients
(lemon, tahini, salt, cayenne pepper) into a little
bowl and whisk together until one smooth
consistency. Add water bit by bit as needed, if
consistency is too thick.
2. Place kale in a bowl, using 1/2 of the dressing
massage the kale until tender.
3. Top with the rest of the ingredients, remaining salad
dressing and mix well.

ingredients.name: Water, filtered (if needed to thin out consistency)

meals.name: Lentil, Kale & Sausage Stew
meals.instruction:
Heat oil in large pot over med-high heat. Add sausage and
cook until browned- about 8-10 mins.
Add onions and cook- about 3-5 mins. Add garlic and cook about 1 min. Add broth, kale, sweet potatoes, and lentils.
Bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer until lentils and sweet
potatoes are tender- about 30-35 mins

meals.name: Turmeric Chickpea Burgers (PEP)
meals.instruction:
In a large cast iron pan, drizzle in a little olive oil and fry the
onion and garlic until slightly golden but not burned.
Remove from heat and allow to cool.
In a food processor, process the chickpeas until they turn to
a slightly textured paste, be sure to turn off the food
processor and scrape down the sides to get all the
chickpeas ground up. Add in onion and garlic, salt, pepper,
turmeric and cayenne pepper and mix to fully combine.
Turn the food processor off and stir in the chopped parsley.
Take a large plate and sprinkle a few tablespoons of
chickpea flour onto it. Using a spoon, scoop some of the
mixture onto your hands and shape into a ball, the size of a
golf ball, and then press gently to make a patty.
Drop into the chickpea flour to coat evenly. If too much flour
sticks to the patty then gently dust it off with your fingers or
a pastry brush. You should have a very light coating all over
the patties/ burgers.
Reheat that same large cast iron pan to medium heat.
Drizzle in a little more oil and place the patties in to cook.
Cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side until the bottom is
nicely browned.
Serve with a big salad for a healthy lunch or dinner.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Wild rice salad
meals.instruction:
1. Cook the rice according to the packet instructions
until tender. Drain, then allow to cool.
2. Roughly chop the mixed nuts, pick and roughly chop
the basil and mint leaves, then roughly chop the
apricots.
3. Combine with the rice, season with sea salt and
black pepper, then drizzle with oil. Serve with grilled
meat or fish.

ingredients.name:
Wild rice, dry (mixed; such as
Camargue, wild and long-grain)

scoop or a heaped tablespoon to scoop meatballs into the

meals.name: Cardamom Quinoa Porridge
meals.instruction:
In a saucepan, bring quinoa, 3/4 cup almond milk, water,
vanilla, salt, and cardamom to a boil. Reduce heat and
simmer, covered, until liquid is absorbed, 15 minutes.
Remove from heat and let rest five minutes, then fluff with
a fork.
For each serving, top 1/2 cup quinoa with 1/2 cup almond
milk, 1/2 sliced pear, and 2 Tbsp almonds.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Kale Chips
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix all ingredients as you would a salad.
Place kale on a cookie sheet and bake until crispy (about 20
minutes, but they may need more time to become crispy). 
Give a stir half way through, and remove from oven to cool
when crispy.
Serve and enjoy!

meals.name: Greens and Beans with Rosemary and Thyme
meals.instruction:
Bring broth to a simmer in a large, high-sided skillet over
medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until
tender, stirring occasionally, about 7 minutes. 
Stir in greens, in batches if needed, along with beans,
rosemary, thyme and crushed red pepper. Cover, reduce
heat to medium and cook 5 minutes, stirring once. Uncover
and cook another 2 minutes or until greens are very tender. 
Stir in black pepper and serve.

meals.name: Hummus-Crusted Chicken
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 450�F. Prepare one large baking dish or two
smaller baking dishes with cooking spray.
Pat the chicken dry. Season the chicken breasts with
generous pinches of salt and pepper. In a large bowl, toss
the zucchini, squash and onion with olive oil until evenly
coated. Season with salt and pepper.
If using one baking dish, place all of the vegetables on the
bottom of the dish in an even layer. Lay the four chicken
breasts evenly on top, then cover each chicken breast with
the hummus so that the entire breast is covered. Squeeze
the juice of one lemon over the chicken and vegetables.
Then sprinkle the pan with smoked paprika or sumac. Thinly
slice the remaining lemon, and place the slices in between
the chicken and vegetables if desired.
**If using two pans, use one for the chicken and one for the
vegetables.**
Bake for about 25-30 minutes, until the chicken is cooked
through and the vegetables are tender. Serve immediately.

meals.name: Salmon with Avocado Salsa Oven Baked
meals.instruction:
Pre-heat the oven to 400 degrees.
Mix the cumin, paprika, garlic powder, black pepper, and
a 1/4 pinch of sea salt.
Coat the salmon with olive oil, the seasoning mix, and the
sliced onions.
Next, cover the pan with a glass lid (parchment paper and
then aluminum foil on top, so the toxins from the aluminum
don't go in the fish).
Place in the oven and cook until done, about 15-20 minutes
depending on the thickness of the fish.
Avocado Salsa
Combine the avocado, onion*, cilantro, lime juice, and 1/2
pinch of sea salt in a bowl and mix well,
Raw onion can be hard to digest. If you are healing
your gut either sautee or steam the onion or leave them
out.
Top the cooked salmon with avocado salsa and enjoy!

meals.name: Toasted Almond Butter
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 350�F.
Place almonds on a large baking sheet and toast for approximately 12-15 minutes.
Place toasted almonds into a large food processor. Process for 2 minutes, then stop and scrape down the sides.
Continue to process for about 7-12 minutes (depends on how powerful your food processor is). You will notice that the almonds will gradually change from a powder to form a large ball.
Continue processing and that ball will break down again and begin to resemble a coarse and pasty almond butter.
Continue processing until the almond butter becomes smooth and moist looking.
Store your almond butter in a glass jar and refrigerate. Note:
Yields 1 1/2 cups which is 24 tbsp. - 2 tbsp. per serving = 12 servings

meals.name: Baked Salmon with Lemon and Thyme
meals.instruction:
Coat fillets with salt, pepper and thyme. Whisk fillets with
lemon juice.
Preheat the oven to 180 C. Place onion on a baking sheet
and put salmon steaks over it.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Serve with steamed rapini and parboiled rice.

meals.name: Hummus-Crusted Chicken
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 450�F. Prepare one large baking dish or two
smaller baking dishes with cooking spray.
Pat the chicken dry. Season the chicken breasts with
generous pinches of salt and pepper. In a large bowl, toss
the zucchini, squash and onion with olive oil until evenly
coated. Season with salt and pepper.
If using one baking dish, place all of the vegetables on the
bottom of the dish in an even layer. Lay the four chicken
breasts evenly on top, then cover each chicken breast with
the hummus so that the entire breast is covered. Squeeze
the juice of one lemon over the chicken and vegetables.
Then sprinkle the pan with smoked paprika or sumac. Thinly
slice the remaining lemon, and place the slices in between
the chicken and vegetables if desired.
**If using two pans, use one for the chicken and one for the
vegetables.**
Bake for about 25-30 minutes, until the chicken is cooked
through and the vegetables are tender. Serve immediately.

meals.instruction:

onion and garlic until slightly golden but not burned.
Remove from heat and allow to cool.
In a food processor, process the chickpeas until they turn to
a slightly textured paste, be sure to turn off the food
processor and scrape down the sides to get all the
chickpeas ground up. Add in onion and garlic, salt, pepper,
turmeric and cayenne pepper and mix to fully combine.
Turn the food processor off and stir in the chopped parsley.
Take a large plate and sprinkle a few tablespoons of
chickpea flour onto it. Using a spoon, scoop some of the
mixture onto your hands and shape into a ball, the size of a
golf ball, and then press gently to make a patty.
Drop into the chickpea flour to coat evenly. If too much flour
sticks to the patty then gently dust it off with your fingers or
a pastry brush. You should have a very light coating all over
the patties/ burgers.
Reheat that same large cast iron pan to medium heat.
Drizzle in a little more oil and place the patties in to cook.
Cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side until the bottom is
nicely browned.
Serve with a big salad for a healthy lunch or dinner.
Enjoy!

meals.name: 3-Ingredient Banana Pancakes
meals.instruction:
In a mixing bowl, crack in the eggs and add in baking
powder. And whisk to combine.
In another bowl add in 1� large bananas. Lightly mash with
a potato masher or a fork, but not too much. There should
be chunks of bananas to make fluffy pancakes. And use
only ripe bananas.
Pour wet mixture into mashed bananas and stir to combine.
In a frying pan, cook mini pancakes over a medium low
heat. 1 or 2 tablespoons of batter is enough for each mini
pancake. When the baking powder is activated, flip it over
and cook for about one minute more. Serve immediately
when hot.

meals.name: Kale Chips
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix all ingredients as you would a salad.
Place kale on a cookie sheet and bake until crispy (about 20
minutes, but they may need more time to become crispy). 
Give a stir half way through, and remove from oven to cool
when crispy.
Serve and enjoy!

meals.name: Cardamom Quinoa Porridge
meals.instruction:
In a saucepan, bring quinoa, 3/4 cup almond milk, water,
vanilla, salt, and cardamom to a boil. Reduce heat and
simmer, covered, until liquid is absorbed, 15 minutes.
Remove from heat and let rest five minutes, then fluff with
a fork.
For each serving, top 1/2 cup quinoa with 1/2 cup almond
milk, 1/2 sliced pear, and 2 Tbsp almonds.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Wild rice salad
meals.instruction:
1. Cook the rice according to the packet instructions
until tender. Drain, then allow to cool.
2. Roughly chop the mixed nuts, pick and roughly chop
the basil and mint leaves, then roughly chop the
apricots.
3. Combine with the rice, season with sea salt and
black pepper, then drizzle with oil. Serve with grilled
meat or fish.

ingredients.name:
Wild rice, dry (mixed; such as
Camargue, wild and long-grain)

meals.name: Sweet Potato Toast with Avocado
meals.instruction:
1. Slice sweet potatoes lengthwise into 1/4 inch slices.
2. Add to the toaster-oven (or regular oven) cook the sweet
potato toast on 375-400 degrees for 15-20 minutes.
3. Remove skin from avocado and slice.
4. Add to toast and sprinkle with sea salt and some lemon
zest (optional).
Enjoy!
Additional Topping Options:
Toasted sesame seeds
Toasted sunflower seeds
Lime Juice
Hummus with or without the avocado

meals.name: Greens and Beans with Rosemary and Thyme
meals.instruction:
Bring broth to a simmer in a large, high-sided skillet over
medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until
tender, stirring occasionally, about 7 minutes. 
Stir in greens, in batches if needed, along with beans,
rosemary, thyme and crushed red pepper. Cover, reduce
heat to medium and cook 5 minutes, stirring once. Uncover
and cook another 2 minutes or until greens are very tender. 
Stir in black pepper and serve.

meals.name: Salmon with Avocado Salsa Oven Baked
meals.instruction:
Pre-heat the oven to 400 degrees.
Mix the cumin, paprika, garlic powder, black pepper, and
a 1/4 pinch of sea salt.
Coat the salmon with olive oil, the seasoning mix, and the
sliced onions.
Next, cover the pan with a glass lid (parchment paper and
then aluminum foil on top, so the toxins from the aluminum
don't go in the fish).
Place in the oven and cook until done, about 15-20 minutes
depending on the thickness of the fish.
Avocado Salsa
Combine the avocado, onion*, cilantro, lime juice, and 1/2
pinch of sea salt in a bowl and mix well,
Raw onion can be hard to digest. If you are healing
your gut either sautee or steam the onion or leave them
out.
Top the cooked salmon with avocado salsa and enjoy!

meals.name: Chicken Zucchini Meat Balls
meals.instruction:
Toss chicken with zucchini, green onion, cilantro, garlic, salt,
and pepper and cumin. Mixture will be quite wet.
Heat oil in a medium pan over medium heat. Use a small
scoop or a heaped tablespoon to scoop meatballs into the
pan. Cook 8-10 at a time for about 5-6 minutes on the first
side. Flip and cook an additional 4-5 minutes, or until
golden brown and the centers are cooked through.

ingredients.name: Zucchini (leave peel on and squeeze grated zucchini in a kitchen towel to remove excess moisture)
Green onion, scallion, ramp (sliced or 1/2 medium white onion)

meals.name: Beet-Ginger Smoothie Bowl
meals.instruction:
Place all the ingredients for the smoothie bowl together in a
high-speed blender and blend on high until smooth. 
Pour into a bowl and top with raspberries, pomegranate
seeds, honey, cacao nibs, and chia seeds.
Serve and enjoy!

meals.name: Plantain Pancakes
meals.instruction:
Peel plantains and add them to a high speed blender with
remaining ingredients and blend until smooth.
Heat griddle or cast iron pan to medium-high heat and add
additional coconut oil to melt.
Using a 1/4 cup measure, ladle out batter to make
pancakes.
When pancakes have a few bubbles and appear dry on top,
flip and cook a few more minute.

meals.instruction:

cook until browned- about 8-10 mins.
Add onions and cook- about 3-5 mins. Add garlic and cook about 1 min. Add broth, kale, sweet potatoes, and lentils.
Bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer until lentils and sweet
potatoes are tender- about 30-35 mins
